description.narrative: The Project is expected to have a positive development impact, contributing to market creation and generating economy-wide and employment effects. As the first majority privately-owned phosphorus fertilizer plant in the country, IKF is expected to stimulate competition and pave the way for further privatizations of state-owned chemical companies. The Project will also contribute to improving the efficiency and increasing the productivity of the manufacturing sector in Uzbekistan.

The project is to finance the privatization and modernization of JSC Kokand Superphosphate Plant, renamed post privatization to JSC Indorama Kokand Fertilizers and Chemicals (IKF or the Company), an outdated phosphate fertilizer plant located in Uzbekistan (the Project). The Company was acquired in 2019 by Indorama Holdings B.V., domiciled in the Netherlands, through direct negotiations with the Government of Uzbekistan. The Project will enable ICP to establish its first fertilizer production facility in Uzbekistan, which has natural feedstock to produce a wide range of fertilizers.
